video.name: Tie a Tie
video.description: How to tie a four-in-hand knot.

step.name: Preparations
step.text: Button your shirt how you'd like to wear it, then drape the tie around your neck. Make the thick end about 1/3rd longer than the short end. For formal button down shirts, it usually works best with the small end of the tie between 4th and 5th button.

step.name: Crossing once
step.text: Cross the long end over the short end. This will form the basis for your knot.

step.name: Second crossing
step.text: Bring the long end back under the short end, then throw it back over the top of the short end in the other direction.

step.name: Loop in
step.text: Now pull the long end through the loop near your neck, forming another loop near your neck.

step.name: Pull and tighten
step.text: Pull the long end through that new loop and tighten to fit!
